instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.ISL6258: What is ISL6258? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2008 through 2009.

threads.title: maybe naive question but can one use ISL from <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message: they all look the same thats way I'm in doubt..

threads.title: maybe naive question but can one use ISL from <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message: read the top of the chip. i forget which schematic is wrong, but there is <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> and <CHIP>ISL6258</CHIP> and i recall the schematic getting it wrong once.

threads.title: maybe naive question but can one use ISL from <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message: Have a board here fully working and it is <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>

threads.title: maybe naive question but can one use ISL from <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message:
[QUOTE="larossmann, post: 5556"]read the top of the chip. i forget which schematic is wrong, but there is <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> and <CHIP>ISL6258</CHIP> and i recall the schematic getting it wrong once. [/QUOTE]
I have replaced the ISL actuallty both of them, but still no green light and no power, i strted to measure from F6905 there im getting 0.49 also on the magsafe pins on J6900 getting 0.49 I also followd your video [url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WYcl2ZkqNjk[/url] and checked <CHIP>U6900</CHIP> and <CHIP>U6901</CHIP> which shows no power at all..
why am i getting 0.49 on J6900 and F6905? checked continuity and it shows 0 on F6905 which is good..

threads.title: maybe naive question but can one use ISL from <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message: Do you have a fake charger? Apple chargers will shut down if something is not good. Testing can sometimes be better with a fake one that is always on.

threads.title: maybe naive question but can one use ISL from <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 5981"]Do you have a fake charger? Apple chargers will shut down if something is not good. Testing can sometimes be better with a fake one that is always on. [/QUOTE]


On a fake charger it shows 0.82 and no light and original 0.58

threads.title: maybe naive question but can one use ISL from <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message: There must be short on the magsafe input then.
